page.title: 06MINISTER OF RATHVEN
page.content: MR. JOHN OSBECK IS THE MINISTER OF RATHVEN, PORTGORDON AND ENZIE CHURCHES. HIS DENOMINATION IS CHURCH OF SCOTLAND. HE CAME TO THE AREA IN 1981 CHOSEN BY HIS CONGREGATION OF ABOUT 500 PEOPLE. BEFORE HE BECAME A MINISTER, MR. OSBECK WAS A NURSE AT A HOSPITAL IN GLASGOW. HE DECIDED TO BECOME A MINISTER BECAUSE HE WANTED TO HELP PEOPLE TO UNDERSTAND THE GOSPEL. HE ALSO WANTED TO HELP PEOPLE WITH PROBLEMS. ON A SUNDAY, THERE ARE THREE SERVICES TO ATTEND MAKING LIFE VERY BUSY. MR. OSBECK, AS CHAPLAIN OF THE SCHOOL, VISITS EVERY FRIDAY. HE PLAYS THE PIANO FOR ASSEMBLY. HE HELPS TEACH PUPILS ABOUT THE BIBLE MESSAGE. HE LIKES TO GET TO KNOW THE CHILDREN WELL.{BY DEBBIE MAIR, LYNNE MCALLISTER
